title: Smoothed Least-laxity-first Algorithm for EV Charging
abstract: We formulate EV charging as a feasibility problem that meets all EVs' energy demands before departure under charging rate constraints and total power constraint. We propose an online algorithm, the smoothed least-laxity-first (sLLF) algorithm, that decides on the current charging rates based on only the information up to the current time. We characterize the performance of the sLLF algorithm analytically and numerically. Numerical experiments with real-world data show that it has significantly higher rate of generating feasible EV charging than several other common EV charging algorithms.
keywords: Online algorithm, online feasibility, resource augmentation, electric vehicle charging
